alert.note: Alert for Darke (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 16 at 9:21AM EST until February 19 at 8:30PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of Indiana and Ohio, including the following counties, in Indiana, Dearborn, Fayette IN, Franklin IN, Ripley, Union IN and Wayne. In Ohio, Auglaize, Butler, Champaign, Clark, Clinton, Darke, Delaware, Fairfield, Fayette OH, Franklin OH, Greene, Hamilton, Hardin, Hocking, Licking, Logan, Madison, Mercer, Miami, Montgomery, Pickaway, Preble, Ross, Shelby, Union OH and Warren. * WHEN...From Thursday morning through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Soils remain moist and excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations.
info.instruction: People in the watch area, especially those living in areas prone to flooding, should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Monitor the latest forecasts and be alert for possible flood warnings.
